attributes.action: Enable Greater Flexible Working For Parents.
attributes.background: The cost of childcare is not the only barrier influencing parents returning to work (that's another story). Many parents find it incredibly difficult to get a job due to the rigidity of working hours. We shouldn't have to choose between going to work or being a parent. Let's change that!
attributes.additional_details:
Currently you can only apply for flexible working arrangements when you have been in employment for 26 weeks. Many job seeking parents cannot work prescribed hours and care for a family, and so they are excluded from the job market. 
Rigid working hours exclude many parents from contributing to society and contributing to their family income.
Enable employers to offer greater flexibility with working hours for parents from the start. Enable flexible start and finish times, not prescribed hours.

attributes.action: Make the carrying and use of self defence weapons legal for woman in the U.K.
attributes.background: In the UK it's illegal to own, carry or use self defence weapons such as CS gas or pepper spray.  Statistics for violent and sexual crimes are on the rise with more woman being attacked each day. A system needs to be put in place where woman can legally own, carry and use self defence weapons.
attributes.additional_details:
http://rapecrisis.org.uk/statistics.php
http://www.bsdgb.co.uk/index.php?Information:Law_Relating_to_Self_Defence

attributes.action: Allow some freedom of movement in any UK-EU trade deal
attributes.background: The UK voted to leave to control immigration but that makes a UK-EU trade deal unlikely. The UK government should allow some degree of freedom of movement so we have full single market access. This is means we are able to trade freely yet have some control on EEA immigration.
attributes.additional_details: We should allow free movement of citizens only on the basis that they have paid taxes and NI for 5 years before claiming welfare. They will only be allowed non urgent healthcare if they reside for at least 6 momths. We will allow EEA students to study under Erasmus but introduce a EEA school permit so they will need to pay an annual fee for state education. This reduces pull factor yet it doesn't violate free movement laws. We can compromise on EU structural funds.

attributes.action: Increase government funding for state schools by 2020.
attributes.background: With the recent increase of funding for grammar schools (£200 million), it is only fair that state schools are also funded since it will affect approximately 93% of the British school children which is 11.7 million. £54 billion is spent on state schools which is around 10.8% of total spending
attributes.additional_details: Please think of your children and or future children.

attributes.action: To stop the repeal of the Human Rights Act 1998
attributes.background: As part of my citizenship coursework, I am doing a campaign around stop the repeal of the Human Rights Act 1998 and having the law replaced with the British Bill of Rights.

attributes.action: Scrap High Speed 2 (HS2). Put forward Hyperloop for consideration.
attributes.background:
HS2 provides minimal gains over our existing rail infrastructure. The cost/ benefit ratio is unacceptable to the taxpayer at £55 billion.

If the UK is to spend this sort of money on a transport project, we should be making substantial leaps.
attributes.additional_details:
This could be achieved by implementing Hyperloop technology instead.

With recent announcements from other nations investing in Hyperloop technology, there is a very real worry that if we commit to HS2, the UK will be investing in the wrong choice. 

We'll end up with an overpriced, lacklustre rail technology that is obsolete before the project even gets started.

attributes.action: Introduce a living will the right to die if diagnose of Alzheimer or dementia
attributes.background:
I am 75 years of age and  I am in good health and sound of mind. I don't want to end my days where I don't know family and friends and I can't do anything for myself ie speak, wash, walk or feed myself. So
 I therefore want the right to die when two doctors say that I have no quality of life
attributes.additional_details:
I have friends and relatives that have either Alzheimer's or dementia. They don't know anybody, they can't feed themselves or wash or go the toilet and some can't even speak.They are just waiting to die, some of them have been like this for more than two years. In the early stages I was told by some of them that they wanted this option and die with dignity
there is no cure for these illnesses

attributes.action: Close Pentonville Prison
attributes.background: This prison is failing both inmates and the general public, and needs to be closed immediately.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/two-prisoners-escape-pentonville-prison-north-london-ministry-justice-a7402701.html

attributes.action: Impose a life long ban for HGV drivers caught driving while using mobile device
attributes.background: I suggest that any HGV driver caught driving whilst using a mobile device, should be issued a instant life long ban. In view of the amount of accidents and deaths caused by this. If applicable an additional fine to the registered keeper of £5000.00 should be issued.
attributes.additional_details: I suggest that any HGV driver caught driving whilst using a mobile device, should be issued a instant life long ban. In view of the amount of accidents and deaths caused by this. If applicable an additional fine to the registered keeper of £5000.00 should be issued. UK courts should also have the power to ban foreign drivers to the UK upon presentation of their licences at UK ports.

attributes.action: Create a new licencing law for people transporting horses in trailers
attributes.background: Many people have accidents caused by inexperienced drivers traveling with horse box's (trailers) every day, Usually because these people dont have the experience or training to tow such a heavy loads, People trained to drive B+E vehicles (car & trailer) are trained with empty loads not live animals.
attributes.additional_details:
After careful research I have found that for than 25% of road traffic collisions are caused by people towing horse trailers with horses in them. 
83% of the 25% are motorway collisions causeing full shut downs on the M4 28 times this year alone. 
I believe that new licensing laws are needed for these people that wish to transport their horses around. Especially using the motorway to lower the risk of further accidents and also the trauma this must cause the animals.

attributes.action: Increase public awareness and penalties for using mobiles whilst driving.
attributes.background: A mother and three young children were needlessly killed by a lorry driver using his phone recently. A massive  government information campaign is needed to help stamp this thoughtless practice out, also use of existing cameras for prosecutions and an instant twelve month ban for offenders as in DD.

attributes.action: Offer support mentally for citizens dealing with life changing disabilities
attributes.background: For example, many people in the UK suffer with a life limiting/ changing disability. Help as such as how to operate a wheelchair, how to tune cochlear implants etc is provided by the nhs. No help mentally is provided to help people adjust to their new lives.
attributes.additional_details: I know many people including myself who have suffered from a life changing disability. Obviously these disabilites have a major effect on our life and how we see it. Out of everyone i know, not one fraction of us was offered someone to talk to.

attributes.action: Agency workers need to be protected against unfair dismissal by law.
attributes.background: After being let go from an agency working position, I realised that agency workers have little to no rights or protection when it comes to unfair dismissal or even being able to have times off for emergencies (unlike their contracted counterparts).

attributes.action: Stop premium rate mobile phone service subscriptions without confirmatory text
attributes.background: Many mobile phone users have found themselves subscribed to premium rate services which are charged to their phone bills simply because they closed an unwanted pop up advert while browsing the internet. There is no cooling off period, and usually no confirmation text so bill payer is not aware!
attributes.additional_details: To stop the charges being levied unfairly there should be a 14 day cooling off period before any service charges, secondly, as many of these services don't send a confirmation text that a subscription has been set up the mobile phone user may not know. The law must be changed to stop these unfair subscriptions and charges.

attributes.action: Make the DWP provide email contact details so deaf people can get in touch too.
attributes.background: Access to work are making it extremely difficult to get back into work and off benefits, leaving people without money during training. I want to make a complaint but on their website they only list telephone numbers. This is useless to a deaf person like myself.
attributes.additional_details:
In order to get access to work help for an interpreter during training, ESA must be cancelled. Training is 3 hours a week on minimum wage before the actual job starts, leaving people with no money. More discrimination here because if an interpreter was not required, a person can claim ESA during training as they are not working enough hours per week to come off it. 

I want to make an official complaint via email and receive a quick response but the DWP only provide telephone numbers.

attributes.action: Make education of communism and its policies mandatory in all education
attributes.background: People need to be aware of the potential of a better life

attributes.action: Hold a confirmatory referendum to give clarity to the EU referendum
attributes.background:
The UK has voted to leave the EU, but it does not know what it wants or how its elected government is to put its wishes into effect.
Proposed second referendum to ask:
Are you sure?
To which answer,
Yes, leave EU at any cost,
No, remain in EU and seek changes to EU constitution
attributes.additional_details:
The UK electorate has now had the opportunity to examine the consequences of the referendum but it has had no voice in saying how the country will pursue its future foreign policy and its trading relationships.
There is anecdotal evidence that the vote was used as a protest against the current political establishment.
A second referendum, if positive, will provide political legitimacy to the current government.

attributes.action: UK government to  strongly criticise the human rights violations in Balochistan.
attributes.background: There has been persecution of religious minorities, targeted killings of civilians, ethnic cleansing of shia muslims, hindus, punjabis, zikris and other minorities by frontier corps and inter service intelligence agency.
attributes.additional_details: This has been brought up by the US government as well as by Declan Welsh in the Guardian. Also Marc Tarabella and Brad Adams (exec. Director of Asian arm of Human Rights Watch) have condemned pakistani government of human rights abuses in balochistan and Azad kashmir. These people deserve to live a free life in their own countries rather than flee seeking justice elsewhere. The UK government needs to show its support to humanitarian causes and rights in every corner of the world.

attributes.action: Require proposed Great Reform Bill to give Parliament a veto on terms of BREXIT.
attributes.background: A repeal bill has been proposed to enable BREXIT, as of the date BREXIT takes effect. We propose this bill contain provisions for a Parliamentary vote or referendum approving the terms of BREXIT, and that for the purposes of the Act BREXIT shall not take effect until such approval has been given.
attributes.additional_details: We the people have the undisputed right, per the 2016 referendum to leave the EU. If the terms of leaving are unacceptable, it should neither be disputed that we have the right to change our minds. While it appears the Prime Minister intents to trigger article 50 without Parliamentary consent or knowledge of a likely deal, Parliament and the people can be given a say by the mechanism described above. The Act means the proposed Great Repeal Bill referred to by Mrs May in Conference on 02/10/2016.

attributes.action: Make it possible  to  pay a modest amount as extra tax  to fund the NHS
attributes.background: So many of us deplore the state of the health service, and the conditions in which  committed professional staff are expected to fulfil the role. Allowing individuals to commit a dedicated amount each month specifically to be spent on the NHS  could correct this .

attributes.action: Make swimming lessons avaliable in all schools
attributes.background: My daughter recently started school I was shocked to find that the school has no Intention to add swimming lessons to its classes surely it's in childrens best interests to ensure they can swim after all how many children drown due to the fact they can't swim
attributes.additional_details: About one in five people who die from drowning are children 14 and. Under

attributes.action: Ban all non prescription flea treatment for pets in the UK
attributes.background: With 13 million UK households owning a pet, it's common for people to rely on cheap flea treatment. Some non prescription flea treatments do NOT work effectively and will not kill fleas. Studies find that they may, however, kill your pets.
attributes.additional_details:
Not only do these treatments not work but they may actually be dangerous. 

A simple Google search reveals that hundreds of dogs and cats have fallen victim to the ingredients used in cheaper treatments and hundreds have actually died. 

Whilst it's understandably difficult to afford proper flea treatment, this is the price of having a pet and as their owners, we are fully responsible.

Please sign to make any non prescription flea treatment illegal.

attributes.action: Introduce a bill to set a higher minimum wage for zero hours contracts
attributes.background:
We call on the government to introduce a bill to set a higher minimum wage for hours worked above contract hours. This would set a higher minimum pay rate for zero hour/minimal hours contracts.

Hours worked above contracted hours the minimum pay rate must be at least 1.25 times the minimum wage.
attributes.additional_details:
The aim of this bill is to target employers who systemically provide employees with contracts for considerably fewer hours than they would normally be expected to work. The most extreme case of this is employers who widely use zero hours contracts.

In the example of a zero hours contract the minimum pay rate would be £9 per hour based on the current National Living Wage of £7.20. The same minimum rate would apply to other overtime.

attributes.action: Reduce VAT on Food & Drink in cafe's etc. to 10% & lower the threshold to £40K
attributes.background: Across Europe there are 14 member countries that charge VAT at 10% or less on food and drink served in pubs, cafes, restaurants etc. Some small businesses falsely declare lower turnovers to ensure they do not come into the VAT scope. Café A pays 20% VAT being honest, Café B pays 0 and avoid VAT.
attributes.additional_details: If the VAT is reduced to 10% this would have a positive effect on the economy and tourism. By lowering the threshold on the same you bring more businesses into scope which would benefit the treasury for the lost VAT income and reduce fraudulent under declaring of turnover closing a tax avoidance loophole. It would also mean that there was a level playing field for businesses to compete and encourage growth. The general public would receive better value and comparison if all on the same tax

attributes.action: Offer more medical school places
attributes.background: The GMC limit the number of places avaliable for students studying medicine at university. By keeping the number of places the same, doctors numbers within the NHS won't rise putting patient care at risk. By offering more places longer term the NHS can employ more doctors and improve patient care

attributes.action: Stop ministers from overuling local councils in rejected planning applications.
attributes.background: A controversial plan for 450 homes on Medway’s green lung will go ahead, after the minister has rubber stamped and ignored local residents and local councillers. This development goes against the very clear wishes of the public.
attributes.additional_details:
Durring the mornings and evenings rush hours the roads around this proposed development are jammed with too many vehicles as it.
 This area of Lordswood simply cannot cope with anymore houses. The local doctors surgerys cannot and will not see the existing patients in a timely manor, The local accident and emergency is the Medway Maritine hospital which is in continual special measures and cant cope. Drainage and water supplies are also strained

attributes.action: 45p/mile Mileage Allowance Payment for walking or cycling for business journeys
attributes.background: The current permitted Mileage Allowance Payment for business travel for the first 10,000 miles for bicycles are less than half the allowance for cars, while there is no tax refund for walking to your local business meeting instead of taking your car.
attributes.additional_details: This would encourage businesses to adopt greener transport and does not need expensive infrastructure and costly enforcement departments.  Firstly, it would incentivise employees to walk or cycle instead of taking their cars for very short journeys; thereby increasing national physical activity levels, improving health, and reducing obesity rates. Secondly, it could reduce the number of vehicles used for short business journeys; thereby reducing congestion and reducing pollution.

attributes.action: Make having a creche for in the workplace and uni mandatory and free for kids.
attributes.background: I am a single mother on benefits and I desperately want to work. Im 22 with no qualifications. I have a high school diploma and I have been well educated in private schools I have a lot to offer if I was given a chance. But you utter single mother and people look at you strange when I do everything.
attributes.additional_details: My child is 1 I want to be able to see her all the time while working. I do not want to live off the state I want to get into the music industry and also get a doctorate in psychology. I dont want to miss out on my daughters youth. There should be a creche at unis and places of work. I want to be independent.

attributes.action: To hold a referendum on whether or not to we continue to pay Foreign Aid
attributes.background: The government debated, loosely, the merits of foreign aid payments as a fixed percentage of GDP back in mid 2016.  This decision needs to be taken out of the hands of government and put into the hands of the people via a referendum.  Circa £12bn per year is at stake to public services.
attributes.additional_details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/125692

attributes.action: Remove the statue of Oliver Cromwell outside Parliament.
attributes.background:
Although he made change for the good, he still became a ruthless dictator. Why should the following be welcomed by parliament:
Killing over 250,000 people whilst conquering Ireland, which Cromwell justified as the "righteous judgment of God upon these barbarous wretches".
attributes.additional_details: He enforced his rule using the military, with the governors who ruled England under him ex-military generals who were extremely brutal. Although Christianity or being a Puritan isn't a defined good or bad trait, he forced all to follow his religion, forcing fasts, banning any form of work on Sunday and banning any fun, like Christmas or work.

attributes.action: Simplify marriage law and remove references to sex or gender
attributes.background:
Marriage in the UK is governed by multiple acts of parliament with specific laws for civil partnership and same sex marriage.  However, the legislation still sees same sex and opposite sex couples differently.

The law should be consolidated and simplified to correct this.
attributes.additional_details:
The law on marriage should be rewritten with all references to sex, gender and/or sexual orientation removed.  Terms for unions should be standardised and include a distinction between religious and civil unions.

When changing legal gender a person should not be required to dissolve or convert an existing union.

Religious organisations should be still allowed to refuse to perform weddings which would contradict their faith but this right should not be limited to same sex marriages.

attributes.action: Ask Mr Trump to conduct his visit virtually and use money saved to support NHS
attributes.background: Her Majesty's Government, in the interest of economy, respectfully request that president Donald Trump, given his preference and aptitude for social media, conduct his visit virtually by electronic means and that the monies saved should be used immediately to support the National Health Service.

attributes.action: Reduce the 10 years Ban for anyone who has at any stage been illegal in the UK.
attributes.background: A new law that deprives qualified settled residents in the UK of becoming British Citizens was enacted in 2014, which has affected a lot of people and has hindered some people from taking up their dream profession which requires you to hold a British passport. There is currently a 10 years ban
attributes.additional_details: This is a plea to the home office to either reduce the length of ban or allow settled residents who have held their permanent residence for over 12 months naturalize .

attributes.action: Make first aid training courses free
attributes.background: There is no price on life. Children should be taught first aid in school. Adults should be taught first aid at work. We should be able to act automatically when someone is in need of life-saving aid.

attributes.action: Insist the US provides explanation as to why J. Miah was denied entry to the US.
attributes.background: Juhel Miah was denied entry to the US based on nothing tangible. Seemingly the reason doesn't even link to the disproportionate and now illegal travel ban enforced by Donald Trump's administration.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Foreign Office has even stated that no one with a British passport will be denied entry to the US - so why?

attributes.action: Tighten rules on companies that charge under 18s as if they were adult
attributes.background: It is unfair that we are not legally classed as an adult, so cannot vote, buy alcohol, be paid the adult minimum wage etc.. , but are expected to pay higher prices as if we were an adult , such as on buses, at cinemas, theme parks, airlines etc

attributes.action: capita to lose the contract for moving nhs records.
attributes.background: I suffer from MS and cannot be referred to a new MS nurse because my record have not reached my new GP after 3 months and some have to wait 6 months+, its not safe.

attributes.action: Make it an offence to impersonate any of our emergency services.
attributes.background:
At present, in the U.K it is only an offence to impersonate a Police Officer and not any of our other emergency services.
With this loop hole, we have members of the public masquerading as Paramedics, Fire Officers and more. This leaves Police officers powerless to act.
attributes.additional_details:
I have produced a short documentary to prove my point, which you can view here.

https://youtu.be/E4k1NOhABWQ

attributes.action: Reduce alcohol duty. High duty disproportionately penalises the poor.
attributes.background: Higher prices do not prevent alcoholism. Reducing duties to a level similar to Belgium will allow, responsible, poorer drinkers to enjoy better quality drinks without having to sacrifice other things.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on Irish unity
attributes.background: with the majority of Northern Ireland voting to remain in the EU and with a new generation now living in peace, it is the right time for the people of Northern Ireland to decide on their long term future democratically and peacefully
attributes.additional_details: It's been 44 years since the last referendum on Irish unity in 1973 and now with a new generation both North and south, with a growing economy in the Republic of Ireland and particularly after the recent Eu referendum with a majority voting in Northern Ireland voting to remain, the time is right to hold a new referendum for the people of Northern Ireland to determine their future peacefully and democratically for the good of all citizens.

attributes.action: Grant automatic asylum to any unaccompanied, displaced child seeking help
attributes.background:
Our MP's recently voted by a majority, to reject a plan for Britain to give shelter and asylum to Syrian children who had arrived in Europe unaccompanied. 
It should be compulsory for our government to grant asylum to vulnerable unaccompanied children, wether orphaned or seperated from family.

attributes.action: Give top Government priority to tackle all sexual abuse, especially child abuse
attributes.background:
Child abuse is a national scandal. 

Rape and sexual abuse of any kind should never be tolerated. Far too little is being done

The Government should give the highest priority to this scandal

This petition pleads for all political parties to unite to stamp down on sexual abuse of all forms
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 20 children are abused (NSPCC)

85,000 women and 12,000 men are raped in England and Wales alone every year

Nearly half a million adults are sexually assaulted each year

In 2015/16 police recorded 23,851 adults were raped; 5878 children. 

Only 2,689 convictions (7.5%). In 2011/12 15% were convicted. These figures are a scandal.

1 in 5 women aged 16 - 59 has experienced some form of sexual violence

Only around 15% of those who experience sexual violence choose to report to the police

attributes.action: PARKING TICKETS: Put clear signage & road markings in restricted parking areas.
attributes.background: Council's should display more signs & have road markings identifying restricted/permit parking areas. Currently, they only have to have a sign on the entrance of the road. These signs can be easily missed, then consequently people are being fined up to £70. This is unfair and needs to be changed.
attributes.additional_details: The requirements for Local Authorities to erect 'Permit Holders Only' repeater signs has been removed which anables the local councils to make more money on these permit holders only areas by not informing the public that the area they are parked in is permit only areas. This is purely a money making scheme and nothing else.

attributes.action: To put extra funding into the NHS .
attributes.background:
We all know about the plight of the NHS , stop using it as a political football , too many Governments past and present have failed the NHS .
At least bring us into line with other European countries as far as funding goes.
Suspend foreign aid or increase Income Tax and N.I. Contributions.

attributes.action: Merge health and social care for the elderly and fund from increased income tax.
attributes.background: A single management line for health and social care would increase efficiency and increased taxation is the fairest way to fund proper care.  Seven day medical and social services would enable capital resources to be better utilised.

attributes.action: Institute a Parliamentary medal  for an  historic contribution to  democracy
attributes.background:
This award will be specifically for contributions to parliamentary democracy as distinct from other types of contributions to public life or to the work of the government or the crown.

 The model should be the Congressional Gold Medal of the United States
attributes.additional_details: For example without the actions of a private citizen Gina Miller  Article 50 would not have been debated in parliament. Gina a private citizen lead a movement resulting in  a historic Supreme Court judgement which will resound down the ages and clarify  the balance of power between parliament and the government. Such a historic contribution to parliamentary democracy should be recognised by the Gold Medal.

attributes.action: Article 50 bill to include an executive confirmation referendum on 30/3/2017.
attributes.background: The article 50 act needs to be passed, but should include a 2nd referendum on 30/3/ 17 askng the UK public to confirm their  wish to leave the EU, in light of a very different world outlook. Peers and MPs would be supporting the democracy of the UK, giving the people a final but now informed choice
attributes.additional_details: The politics of the world are very different than 23 June 2016, when Trump and the option of hard Brexit was not a consideration. Much of the argument on both sides has proven to be false. Any reasonable individual would think it only right and proper to reflect and review a decision made in their personal life if circumstances changed. It is only right the UK population is allowed to do the same. A 2nd leave vote would however also give the UK govt a full and informed mandate from the people.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for male toilets to have baby change facilities.
attributes.background: When my fiancé takes out our kids and they just have male/female toilets, there are no baby change facilities in the male toilets! He either has to use the floor or do it in the car which isnt ideal. There are so many more involved dads nowadays, we need to make things more accessible for them too!

attributes.action: Suspend all new legislation and submit to an independent legal compliancy audit
attributes.background: A substantial number of recent legal cases, political events and commentaries on regulatory changes have found the Government to be in breach, de facto and de jure, of a substantial number of its legal obligations under International Law, Human Rights Law, the Constitutional Law of the UK, etc.
attributes.additional_details:
Therefore, the Government should announce legislation to suspend all proposed legislative and regulatory changes, including those made under discretionary (budgetary and departmental) competences, and submit to a full legal compliancy audit by an independent company.

This audit will assess the legality, proportionality and justiciability of current legislation and policy, as well as the role of expert partners, such as the ONS, and stakeholders, in forming Government policy and legislation.

attributes.action: Action by parliament to stop the proliferation of graffiti in towns and cities.
attributes.background: Graffiti on buildings Is endemic throughout the UK. Measures should be place to stop this anti social practice and clean up the mess created. This should involve hefty fines, community service to remove graffiti and imprisonment for repeat offenders.
